title: 110_hr2445
content: SECTION 1. ALEXANDER CREEK VILLAGE RECOGNITION. The Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act is amended to include "Alexander Creek Village recognition." The Village of Alexander Creek in Alaska is recognized as an eligible Native village. Definitions for terms like 'agency' and 'conservation system unit' are provided in this section. Alexander Creek refers to Alexander Creek Incorporated, an Alaska Native Group corporation. The Alexander Creek account is established by the Secretary of the Treasury in consultation with the Secretary of the Interior. Funds in the account are available for Alexander Creek to bid on and purchase property at public sale. The Alexander Creek account allows the use of funds to bid on and purchase property in Alaska at public sales by agencies. The Secretary of the Treasury will adjust the account balance accordingly. Procedures for transactions related to the account will be established by the Secretary of the Treasury in consultation with the Secretary of the Interior. The Alexander Creek account allows the use of funds for property purchases in Alaska. Unused escrow deposits will be reinstated if a sale is not completed. The Secretary of the Interior will negotiate a land exchange to acquire additional public lands for Alexander Creek. The initial balance of the account will be based on the fair market value of deficiency selections made by Alexander Creek. The Alexander Creek account is used for property purchases in Alaska. If land is conveyed to Alexander Creek, the account is reduced by the actual acres multiplied by the average value per acre. The subsurface estate of lands conveyed to Alexander Creek is transferred to the Region without cost. The fair market value of selected parcels is determined for deposit into the account, considering public interest as the highest use. Alexander Creek can present evidence of value to the Secretary for appraisal. The Secretary shall provide Alexander Creek with a preliminary draft of the appraisal, allowing for comments. A certified copy of the appraisal will be forwarded to Alexander Creek. Alexander Creek may assign its account upon notification to the Treasury and Interior Secretaries. Assigned funds will be added to the Region's Property Account for use as other funds. Upon certification of the appraisal by the Secretary of the Interior, Alexander Creek accepts the terms of this section instead of other land entitlements. Any land conveyed to Alexander Creek will be considered a conveyance under this Act. Sales from the account will be administered in the same manner as other Native villages authorized by law. The section limits agents' and attorneys' fees to 2.5 percent of payments received by Alexander Creek. Violators may face misdemeanor charges and fines under title 18, United States Code.
